metadata.Title: CVE-2023-20938 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium.
metadata.Description:
In binder_transaction_buffer_release of binder.c, there is a possible use after free due to improper input validation. This could lead to local escalation of privilege with no additional execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.Product: AndroidVersions: Android kernelAndroid ID: A-257685302References: Upstream kernel It was discovered that the Android Binder IPC subsystem in the Linux kernel did not properly validate inputs in some situations, leading to a use- after-free vulnerability. A local attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (system crash) or possibly execute arbitrary code.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-20938` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.15.0-72-generic - 5.15.0-72.79
linux-image-5.15.0-72-generic-lpae - 5.15.0-72.79
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-72-generic - 5.15.0-72.79
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-72-generic-64k - 5.15.0-72.79
No subscription required

notes.Note: sbeattie> affects the binder IPC mechanism the break commits for the last three fix commits are the introduction of binder into the staging tree, there may be a tighter bound for them.
